config_description: Total permitted memory to use for memtables. Cassandra will stop accepting writes when the limit is exceeded until a flush completes, and will trigger a flush based on memtable_cleanup_threshold If omitted, Cassandra will set both to 1/4 the size of the heap. memtable_heap_space_in_mb: 2048
developer_understanding_on_working: The 'memtable_offheap_space_in_mb' configuration is used to set the total permitted memory to use for off-heap memtables in Cassandra. The code snippet provided shows that the offHeapLimit is calculated by shifting the value of 'memtable_offheap_space_in_mb' left by 20 bits, which effectively multiplies the value by 2^20 to convert it to bytes.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the 'memtable_offheap_space_in_mb' configuration in the system depends on the memtable_cleanup_threshold set in the configuration. When the off-heap memtable space exceeds the threshold, Cassandra will trigger a flush to clear the memtable and free up space for new writes.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'memtable_offheap_space_in_mb' configuration on the system is significant as it determines the total memory available for off-heap memtables. If the configured value is too low, it can lead to frequent flushes and performance degradation. On the other hand, setting it too high can result in excessive memory usage and potential out-of-memory errors.
